Title: [SQL] Make OrcFileFormat CONFIGurable between sql/hive and sql/core
Note: This issue depends on SPARK-20682 and aims to provide a configuration to choose the default ORCFileFormat from legacy `sql/hive` module or new `sql/core` module.

Title: Make the mapping of com.databricks.spark.avro to built-in module configurable
Note: In https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-24924, the data source provider com.databricks.spark.avro is mapped to the new package org.apache.spark.sql.avro. make the mapping of com.databricks.avro => internal avro configurable, that would allow them to continue use their version of com.databricks.avro until they can update api.

Title: Configurable type coercion policy for table insertion
Note: To ensure backward compatibility with existing queries, the default store assignment policy for data source V1 is "legacy" before ANSI mode is implemented.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: You can't deny this large class of use cases out there (probably makes up half of Spark use cases actually)

Title: Add an option to enable/disable rs group feature
New scenario/use case: Concrete task: if you want the pre 3.0.0 hbase client/shell to communicate with the new hbase cluster
Note: The coprocessor org.apache.hadoop.hbase.rsgroup.RSGroupAdminEndpoint is deprected, but for compatible, if you want the pre 3.0.0 hbase client/shell to communicate with the new hbase cluster, you still need to add this coprocessor to master.

Title: Division operator support integral division
Note: This pr add a flag(`spark.sql.function.preferIntegralDivision`) to control whether to use integral division with the `/` operator.

Title: [SQL][FOLLOW-UP] Add a SQLConf for enhanced Hive partition pruning predicate pushdown
Note: we don't backport such risky changes to maintenance branches.

Title: turn tracking of TaskMetrics._updatedBlockStatuses off
Note: We leave the api there as well as a config to turn it back on just in case anyone is using it.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity:If its not being used we should remove it

Title: [CORE] Add conf to revert to old code.
Note: In case there are any issues in converting FileSegmentManagedBuffer to ChunkedByteBuffer, add a conf to go back to old code path.

Title: Add a legacy flag to restore old session init behavior
Note: Add a legacy flag to restore the old session init behavior, where SparkConf defaults take precedence over configs in a parent session.

Title: Disable old native protocol versions on demand
Note: This will help operators selectively reject connections from clients that do not support the latest protoocol.

Parameter: ignoreNullFields (API configuration whose normal configuration is: spark.sql.jsonGenerator.ignoreNullFields)
Title: [FOLLOWUP] add doc and python PARAMETER for ignoreNullFields in json generating
New scenario/use case: concrete environment: Enable user to use ignoreNullFields in pyspark (as in Spark)
Note: DataSet.toJSON will lost some column when field data is null. Maybe it is better to keep null data in some scenarios. Such as sparkmagic, which is widely used in jupyter with livy, we use toJSON to toJSON is used to get sql results. with toJSON sparkmagic may return empty results, which confused users.Maybe adding a config is the best choice. This configuration retains the current semantics and will remain fields with null until the configuration is modified.

Parameter: mergeSchema (API configuration whose normal configuration is: spark.sql.parquet.mergeSchema)
Title: Expose mergeSchema OPTION in PySpark's ORC APIs
Note: Why are the changes needed? So the Python API matches the Scala API.

Title: Use default datasource as provider for CREATE TABLE syntax
Note: Changing the default provider from `hive` to the value of `spark.sql.sources.default` for "CREATE TABLE" syntax to make it be consistent with DataFrameWriter.saveAsTable API. Also, it brings more friendly to end users since Spark is well know of using parquet(default value of `spark.sql.sources.default`) as its default I/O format.

Title: Improve RpcServer TRACE logging
Note: We truncate RpcServer output to 1000 characters for trace logging. Would be better if that value was configurable.

Title: Make plan change log in RuleExecutor configurable by SQLConf
Note: such information can be very helpful for debugging, so making the log level configurable in SQLConf would allow users to turn on the plan change log independently and save the trouble of tweaking log4j settings. Meanwhile, filtering plan change log for specific rules can also be very useful.

Title: [PYTHON] Configuration to select the modules for daemon and worker in PySpark
New scenario/use case: vague task: it's sometimes hard to debug what happens
Note: We are now forced to use pyspark/daemon.py and pyspark/worker.py in PySpark tests.

Title: [PYTHON] Configuration to select the modules for daemon and worker in PySpark
New scenario/use case: vague task: it's sometimes hard to debug what happens
Note: We are now forced to use pyspark/daemon.py and pyspark/worker.py in PySpark tests.

Title: Add force delete temp checkpoint configuration
New scenario/use case: vague workload: running the stream application multiple times
Note: Not all users wants to keep temporary checkpoint directories.

Title: [CORE] Allow BlockUpdated events to be optionally logged to the event log
New scenario/use case: vague Task: get a better understanding of caching for a job
Note: I see that block updates are not logged to the event log. This makes sense as a default for performance reasons. However, I find it helpful when trying to get a better understanding of caching for a job to be able to log these updates.

Title: make DEFAULT_MAX_CORRUPT_FILEBLOCKS_RETURNED configurable
Note: Current, the easiest way to determine which blocks is missing is using NN web UI or JMX. Unfortunately, because the DEFAULT_MAX_CORRUPT_FILEBLOCKS_RETURNED=100 is hard code in FSNamesystem, only 100 missing blocks can be return by UI and JMX.

Title: Enable use of long form of callsite in logs
Note: It would be nice if the long form of the callsite information could be included in the log. I don't expect it will be widely used but I've personally found it helpful in some performance debugging and it's a fairly low impact change.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: Although maybe not widely used, I could see allowing control of this via an undocumented param

Title: Adds a config option to keep executor pods for debugging
New scenario/use case: concrete usecase: if a pod fails to start due to some failure
Impact: Failure: These sequence of events go on, until the app is killed
Note: Currently, if a pod fails to start due to some failure, it gets removed and new one is attempted. These sequence of events go on, until the app is killed. Given the speed of creation and deletion, it becomes difficult to debug the reason for failure. So adding a configuration parameter to disable auto-deletion of pods, will be helpful for debugging.

Title: sstableloader doesn't support non default storage_port and ssl_storage_port
Note: The proposed fix is to add command line option for these two ports like what NATIVE_PORT_OPTION currently does

Title: sstableloader doesn't support non default storage_port and ssl_storage_port
Note: The proposed fix is to add command line option for these two ports like what NATIVE_PORT_OPTION currently does

Title: Directory used for sidelining old recovered edits files should be made configurable
Note: Currently the directory used for sidelining of old recovered edit files is hardcoded to be "/tmp" Instead, we can use some configurable directory in the following manner:

Title: Make executor's bindAddress CONFIGURABLE
New scenario/use case: concrete Environment: Kernel-based Virtual Machine (KVM)'s are used inside Linux container
Impact: Failure:  wouldn't have worked for multiple executors.

Title: RegionMover should use the configured default port number and not the one from HConstants
Note: it was an error due the argument passed to the RegionMover.

Title: [CORE] Ignore SPARK_LOCAL* env while deploying via cluster mode.
New scenario/use case: concrete Environment: in a bare metal system with No DNS setup
Impact: Failure:driver fail over will not work
Note: In a bare metal system with No DNS setup, spark may be configured with SPARK_LOCAL* for IP and host properties.

Title: Support multi-homing env for the publication of RS status with multicast
New scenario/use case: concrete usecase: host has the multiple network interfaces and the unreachable one to the other nodes is selected.
Note: Currently, when the publication feature is enabled (hbase.status.published=true), it uses the interface which is found first.This won't work when the host has the multiple network interfaces and the unreachable one to the other nodes is selected.

Title: Support multi-homing env for the publication of RS status with multicast
New scenario/use case: concrete usecase: host has the multiple network interfaces and the unreachable one to the other nodes is selected.
Note: Currently, when the publication feature is enabled (hbase.status.published=true), it uses the interface which is found first.This won't work when the host has the multiple network interfaces and the unreachable one to the other nodes is selected.

Title: Add BIND_HOST configuration for JournalNode's HTTP and RPC Servers
Note: Allow configurable bind-host for JournalNode's HTTP and RPC servers to allow overriding the hostname for which the server accepts connections.

Title: Add BIND_HOST configuration for JournalNode's HTTP and RPC Servers
Note: Allow configurable bind-host for JournalNode's HTTP and RPC servers to allow overriding the hostname for which the server accepts connections.

Title: Add BIND_HOST configuration for JournalNode's HTTP and RPC Servers
Note: Allow configurable bind-host for JournalNode's HTTP and RPC servers to allow overriding the hostname for which the server accepts connections.

Title: Block Storage: make the iscsi target addres configurable for discovery.
Note: For example in kubernetes the iscsi server could run behind a service where the address (where the jscsi server is available from the cluster) could be different from the targetAddress where the server is listening.

Title: Block Storage: make the iscsi target addres configurable for discovery.
Note: For example in kubernetes the iscsi server could run behind a service where the address (where the jscsi server is available from the cluster) could be different from the targetAddress where the server is listening.

Title: Add ability for HBase Canary to ignore a configurable number of ZooKeeper down nodes
Note: If we use the Canary to gauge server health, and alert accordingly, this can be too strict. For example, in a 5-node ZooKeeper cluster, having one node down is safe and expected in rolling upgrades/patches.

Title: Client is not able to execute REST queries in a secure cluster
Note: But the problem here was the browser client negotiate with server by first sending a HTTP request with method type as OPTIONS and this method we have added as a constraint in the security handler.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: I added that first then removed, thinking that it works as it is and adding one more new configuration which I felt whose value will not be changed from its default, made no sense to me.

Title: [SQL] Supports custom line separator for json datasource
Note: Spark csv and text readers always use default CR, LF or CRLF line terminators without an option to configure a custom delimiter.

Title: Make maven central repository in IsolatedClientLoader configurable
Note: it can be used as the additional remote repositories for the default maven central repo.

Title: Support ignoring missing files
Note: There's an existing flag "spark.sql.files.ignoreCorruptFiles" that will quietly ignore attempted reads from files that have been corrupted, but it still allows the query to fail on missing files. Being able to ignore missing files too is useful in some replication scenarios.

Title: Let NameNode to bypass external attribute provider for configured users.
New scenario/use case: concrete Task: do distcp from one cluster to another
Note: We want to avoid saving metadata from external provider to HDFS, so we want to bypass external provider when doing the distcp (or hadoop fs -cp) operation

Title: Thrift] Make principal CONFIGurable in DemoClient.javaAdded OPTIONal (fourth) parameter "server-principal"
New scenario/use case: concrete Task :using hbase-thrift to separate the names from those of backend servers
Note: This will only work when the Thrift server is started with the hbase principal. Often this may deviate, for example I am using hbase-thrift to separate the names from those of backend servers. What we need is either an additional command line option to specify the name, or a property that can be set with -D and can be passed at runtime. I prefer the former, as the latter is making this a little convoluted.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: as the latter is making this a little convoluted.

Title: Decide if META/System tables should use Compacting Memstore or Default Memstore
Impact: uxepected result:the comparators passed to the CellChunkImmutableSegment and CellArrayImmutableSegment are sometimes wrong
Note: That simplifies the issue but it doesn't bring any reason. Perhaps someone will raise another issue about "all system tables should be assigned to compacting memstore". As i see it, a workaround is to make it configurable, and the default memstore is the default setting.

Title: Allow dynamic allocation without an external shuffle service
New scenario/use case: concrete task: One immediate use case is the ability to use dynamic allocation on Kubernetes, which doesn't yet have that service.
Note: It would be useful for users to be able to enable dynamic allocation without the need to provision an external shuffle service. One immediate use case is the ability to use dynamic allocation on Kubernetes, which doesn't yet have that service.

Title: NetworkTopology should be configurable when enable DFSNetworkTopology
Note: I think we should still make the NetworkTopology configurable rather than hard code the implementation since we may need another NetworkTopology impl.

Title: RBF: Configurable value in xml for async connection request queue size.
Note: This a very critical parameter for routers, admins would like to change this without doing a new build.

Title: EC : Add Configuration to restrict UserDefined Policies
Note: By default addition of erasure coding policies is enabled for users.We need to add configuration whether to allow addition of new User Defined policies or not.Which can be configured in for of a Boolean value at the server side.

Title: Improve storage policy satisfier configuration
Note: if file is not able to satisfy for some reasons like not enough storages etc, we may keep retry

Title: Make Datanode Netty reverse proxy port to be configurable
Note: In some of the deployments, customers want to have the control over all listening ports. So that they logically separates server/listening ports from client ports. For this they prefer no random ports to be allocated for listening.

Title: Add flag to disable materialized views and warnings on creation
Note: Materialized views are considered experimental and are not recommended for production use.

Title: Support application priority for YARN priority scheduling
New scenario/use case: vague usecase: can set priority to an application for YARN to define pending applications ordering policy, those with higher priority have a better opportunity to be activated.
Note: We can set priority to an application for YARN to define pending applications ordering policy, those with higher priority have a better opportunity to be activated. YARN CapacityScheduler only.

Title: Support executor for selecting scheduler through scheduler name in the case of k8s multi-scheduler scenario
New scenario/use case: vague usecase: support executor for selecting scheduler through scheduler name.
Note: In the case of k8s multi-scheduler, support executor for selecting scheduler through scheduler name.

Title: Add CONFIGURATION to support JacksonGenrator to keep fields with null values
New scenario/use case: concrete task: it is better to keep null data in some scenarios. Such as sparkmagic, which is widely used in jupyter with livy, we use toJSON to toJSON is used to get sql results. with toJSON sparkmagic may return empty results, which confused users.
Impact: Failure: may cause parsing exceptions or loss of entire column data.
Note: DataSet.toJSON will lost some column when field data is null. Maybe it is better to keep null data in some scenarios. Such as sparkmagic, which is widely used in jupyter with livy, we use toJSON to toJSON is used to get sql results. with toJSON sparkmagic may return empty results, which confused users.Maybe adding a config is the best choice. This configuration retains the current semantics and will remain fields with null until the configuration is modified.

Title: Add a CONFIG to control plan stats computation in LogicalRelation
Impact: uxepected result: cannot currently enable StarSchemaDetection.reorderStarJoins
Note: We cannot currently enable StarSchemaDetection.reorderStarJoins because we need to turn off CBO to enable it but StarSchemaDetection internally references LogicalPlan.stats.rowCount. This rowCount is used in LogicalRelation if CBO disabled.This ticket is to propose a new separate config so that LogicalRelation can use rowCount to compute data statistics.

Title: RBF: Choose to enable the default nameservice to read/write files
New scenario/use case: concrete Task: we need all files to be written in the location from the MountTableEntry
Impact: uxepected result: files written in unknown location
Note: as cluster administrator, It is not better to happen some files are written in some unknown location.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: as cluster administrator

Title: add a new config to diskWriteBufferSize which is hard coded before
Note: With spark.shuffle.spill.diskWriteBufferSize configure diskWriteBufferSize of ShuffleExternalSorter. when change the size of the diskWriteBufferSize to test `forceSorterToSpill` The average performance of running 10 times is as follows
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: What's the use case for exposing these as more config options? what would cause the user to need to set these separately?

Title: Interface ReplicationEndpoint extends Guava's Service
Note: unknow

Title: RBF: MIN_ACTIVE_RATIO should be configurable
Note: It affects cleanup and creating Connections. Maybe it should be configurable so that we can reconfig it to improve performance

Title: [SQL] Use OffHeapColumnVector when "spark.sql.columnVector.offheap.enable" is set to "true"
Note: While ColumnVector has two implementations OnHeapColumnVector and OffHeapColumnVector, only OnHeapColumnVector is used.

Title: [SQL] Make sample points per partition (in range partitioner) CONFIGurable and bump the default value up to 100
Note: Spark's RangePartitioner hard codes the number of sampling points per partition to be 20. This is sometimes too low. This ticket makes it configurable, via spark.sql.execution.rangeExchange.sampleSizePerPartition, and raises the default in Spark SQL to be 100.

Title: [SQL] Make vectorized columar reader batch size CONFIGurable
Note: Make the capacity of `VectorizedParquetRecordReader` configurable

Title: [SQL] Make vectorized columar reader batch size CONFIGurable
Note: Make the capacity of `OrcColumnarBatchReader` configurable

Title: Use Spark conf for threshold at which UDF is compressed by broadcast
Note: The _prepare_for_python_RDD method currently broadcasts a pickled command if its length is greater than the hardcoded value 1 << 20 (1M). We would like to set this value as a Spark conf instead.

Title: LogRollMasterProcedureManager: make procedure timeout thread pool size configurable
Note: The default procedure timeout of 60 sec and pool size (1) may be not optimal for large deployments

Title: LogRollMasterProcedureManager: make procedure timeout thread pool size configurable
Note: The default procedure timeout of 60 sec and pool size (1) may be not optimal for large deployments

Title: Allow configuring test master initialization wait time.
Note: We can configure how long the local cluster threads will wait for master to come up and become active, but not how long we allow initialization to take. Being able to tune this would improve my test loop on some experiment I am running.

Title: Add per-user metrics with lossy counting
Note: to disable user metrics in case it accounts for any performance issues, Per-user metrics will be useful in multi-tenant cases where we can emit number of requests, operations, num RPCs etc at the per-user aggregate level per regionserver. We currently have throttles per user, but no way to monitor resource usage per-user.

Title: Expose BucketCache values to be CONFIGuredBefore this commit BucketCache always used the default values.This commit adds the ability to CONFIGure these values
New scenario/use case: vague workload: single access, multi access, and in-memory access.
Note: BucketCache always uses the default values for all cache configuration. However, this doesn't work for all use cases. In particular, users want to be able to configure the percentage of the cache that is single access, multi access, and in-memory access.

Title: Expose BucketCache values to be CONFIGuredBefore this commit BucketCache always used the default values.This commit adds the ability to CONFIGure these values
New scenario/use case: vague workload: single access, multi access, and in-memory access.
Note: BucketCache always uses the default values for all cache configuration. However, this doesn't work for all use cases. In particular, users want to be able to configure the percentage of the cache that is single access, multi access, and in-memory access.

Note: BucketCache always uses the default values for all cache configuration. However, this doesn't work for all use cases. In particular, users want to be able to configure the percentage of the cache that is single access, multi access, and in-memory access.

Note: BucketCache always uses the default values for all cache configuration. However, this doesn't work for all use cases. In particular, users want to be able to configure the percentage of the cache that is single access, multi access, and in-memory access.

Title: Expose BucketCache values to be CONFIGuredBefore this commit BucketCache always used the default values.This commit adds the ability to CONFIGure these values
New scenario/use case: vague workload: single access, multi access, and in-memory access.
Note: BucketCache always uses the default values for all cache configuration. However, this doesn't work for all use cases. In particular, users want to be able to configure the percentage of the cache that is single access, multi access, and in-memory access.

Title: Provide a CONFIGurable param to hsync WAL edits to the disk for better durability
Note: At present we do not have an option to hsync WAL edits to the disk for better durability. In our local tests we see 10-15% latency impact of using hsync instead of hflush which is not very high.

Title: [SQL] add a CONFIG to turn off vectorized cache reader
New scenario/use case: concrete workload: 10.4GB input from hive orc files /18.8 GB cached/5592 partitions
Note: I was testing spark 2.3 rc2 and I am seeing a performance regression in sql queries on cached data.

Title: Bump SSTable level instead of rewriting SSTable completely during single-sstable compactions
New scenario/use case: concrete workload: a ton of newly inserted partitions that will never merge in compactions
Impact: perf: affect the overall compaction throughput
Note: a ton of newly inserted partitions that will never merge in compactions
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: which is probably the worst kind of workload for LCS

Title: Size of in-memory compaction thread pool should be configurable
New scenario/use case: concrete workload: many regions in one region server
Note: introduced an new config key in this issue: hbase.regionserver.inmemory.compaction.pool.size. the default value would be 10. you can configure this to set the pool size of in-memory compaction pool. Note that all memstores in one region server will share the same pool, so if you have many regions in one region server, you need to set this larger to compact faster for better read performance.

Title: Allow users to remove RegionFinder from LoadBalancer calculations if no locality possible
New scenario/use case: concrete Environment: FileSystems that do not surface locality
Note: BaseLoadBalancer should have the option to remove RegionFinder(quickly lookup cloud and region infomation of application deployment) from load balancing. This provides significant cluster start time reduction for FileSystems that do not surface locality such as Amazon S3.

Title: Make the threshold for highly compressed map status configurable
New scenario/use case: vague task: easily tune their jobs
Impact: perf: could be increasing # of output files when you don't want to be, affects the # of tasks needs and thus executors to run in parallel, etc.
Note: MapStatus uses hardcoded value of 2000 partitions to determine if it should use highly compressed map status. We should make it configurable to allow users to more easily tune their jobs with respect to this without having for them to modify their code to change the number of partitions. Note we can leave this as an internal/undocumented config for now until we have more advise for the users on how to set this config.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: Note we can leave this as an internal/undocumented config for now until we have more advise for the users on how to set this config.

Title: Allow TWCS to ignore overlaps when dropping fully expired sstables
Impact: perf: CPU intensive and time consuming
Note: you really want read-repairs, looking for fully expired ones

Title: explain should not trigger partition listing
New scenario/use case: concrete Workload: a) all the bucket columns are read. b) there is only one file in each bucket.
Impact: perf: get stuck for a while
Note: Sometimes when you explain a query, you will get stuck for a while. What's worse, you will get stuck again if you explain again. The outputOrdering is not very useful. We can only apply it if a) all the bucket columns are read. b) there is only one file in each bucket. This condition is really hard to meet, and even if we meet, sorting an already sorted file is pretty fast and avoiding the sort is not that useful. I think it's worth to give up this optimization so that explain don't need to get stuck.

Title: Make the split threshold for the code generated method configurable
Impact: perf: have a big performance impact for the client operations
Note: When the generated Java function source code exceeds `spark.sql.codegen.methodSplitThreshold`, it will be split into multiple small functions. This is useful for performance tuning
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity:(test), but fianlly become general because "It should be useful for performance tuning. - from a Contributor"

Title: Support the offsetLock of bucketCache to use strong ref
Note: The offsetLock of bucketCache use soft reference based impl by default,it could reclaim mem when not enough,but a lot of soft reference object would lead to long puase when mixed gc occurs,so if the count of offset is limited and you have enough mem(most of the time it is true),then the strong reference is better choice.

Title: [SQL] Add an option to disable record-level filter in Parquet-side
Note: It seems Spark-side codegen row-by-row filtering might be faster than Parquet's one in general due to type-boxing and virtual function calls which Spark's one tries to avoid. Maybe we should perform a benchmark and disable this.

Title: Add spark.sql.fast.hash.aggregate.row.max.capacity to configure the capacity of fast aggregation.
Note: give performance comparison, this pr add a configuration parameter to configure the capacity of fast aggregation.

Title: Reduce heap pressure during compactions
New scenario/use case: concrete workload: Small partition compactions(KeyCacheKey dominating heap pressure)
Note: Small partition compactions

Title: Add a runtime buffer size CONFIGURation for Pandas UDFs
New scenario/use case: vague scale: when multiple pandas UDF plans are pipelined.
Impact: perf: the donwstream UDF's pipeline will lag behind too much, which may increase the total processing time.
Note: This could improve performance when multiple pandas UDF plans are pipelined.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity:Since these don't occur during normal operation, we can use rather lengthy timeouts, and don't need to make them configurable

Title: Provide an option to skip calculating block locations for SnapshotInputFormat
Impact: perf: this process may take a long time
Note: When a MR job is reading from SnapshotInputFormat, it needs to calculate the splits based on the block locations in order to get best locality. However, this process may take a long time for large snapshots.

Title: Make large/small file clean thread number configurable in HFileCleaner
Note: Currently we have only one thread for both large and small file cleaning, but when write pressure is huge we might need more cleaner threads, so we need to make the thread number configurable

Title: Make large/small file clean thread number configurable in HFileCleaner
Note: Currently we have only one thread for both large and small file cleaning, but when write pressure is huge we might need more cleaner threads, so we need to make the thread number configurable

Title: Bump SSTable level instead of rewriting SSTable completely during single-sstable compactions
New scenario/use case: concrete Workload:a ton of newly inserted partitions that will never merge in compactions
Note: a ton of newly inserted partitions that will never merge in compactions
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity:which is probably the worst kind of workload for LCS

Title: [SQL] Add a static CONFIG to control cache size for generated classes
Note: The cache 100 in CodeGenerator is too small for realtime streaming calculation, although is ok for offline calculation. Because realtime streaming calculation is mostly more complex in one driver, and performance sensitive.

Title: Make MAX_WAIT and waitIfNotFinished in CleanerContext configurable
Note: 1. While deleting a oldwal never complete (strange but possible), then delete file task needs to wait for a max of 60 seconds. Here, 60 seconds might be too long, or the opposite way is to increase more than 60 seconds in the use cases of slow file delete. 2. The check and wait of a file delete is set to default in the period of 500 milliseconds, one might want to tune this checking period to a short interval to check more frequently or to a longer interval to avoid checking too often to manage their delete file task checking period (the longer interval may be use to avoid checking too fast while using a high latency storage).

Title: Make MAX_WAIT and waitIfNotFinished in CleanerContext configurable
Note: 1. While deleting a oldwal never complete (strange but possible), then delete file task needs to wait for a max of 60 seconds. Here, 60 seconds might be too long, or the opposite way is to increase more than 60 seconds in the use cases of slow file delete. 2. The check and wait of a file delete is set to default in the period of 500 milliseconds, one might want to tune this checking period to a short interval to check more frequently or to a longer interval to avoid checking too often to manage their delete file task checking period (the longer interval may be use to avoid checking too fast while using a high latency storage).

Note: 1. While deleting a oldwal never complete (strange but possible), then delete file task needs to wait for a max of 60 seconds. Here, 60 seconds might be too long, or the opposite way is to increase more than 60 seconds in the use cases of slow file delete. 2. The check and wait of a file delete is set to default in the period of 500 milliseconds, one might want to tune this checking period to a short interval to check more frequently or to a longer interval to avoid checking too often to manage their delete file task checking period (the longer interval may be use to avoid checking too fast while using a high latency storage).

Title: [CORE] Allow user to filter out empty split in HadoopRDD
New scenario/use case: concrete workload: Hive will create an empty table with many empty files
Impact: Resouce overuse: Spark will spends much more resources
Note: Sometimes, Hive will create an empty table with many empty files, Spark use the InputFormat stored in Hive Meta Store and will not combine the empty files and therefore generate many tasks to handle this empty files. Hive use CombineHiveInputFormat(hive.input.format) by default. So, in this case, Spark will spends much more resources than hive.

Title: [CORE] Avoid calling reserveUnrollMemoryForThisTask for every record
New scenario/use case: concrete Task: When Spark persist data to Unsafe memory
Note: When Spark persist data to Unsafe memory, we call the method `MemoryStore.putIteratorAsBytes`, which need synchronize the `memoryManager` for every record write. This implementation is not necessary, we can apply for more memory at a time to reduce unnecessary synchronization.

Title: [CORE] Avoid calling reserveUnrollMemoryForThisTask for every record
New scenario/use case: concrete Task: When Spark persist data to Unsafe memory
Note: When Spark persist data to Unsafe memory, we call the method `MemoryStore.putIteratorAsBytes`, which need synchronize the `memoryManager` for every record write. This implementation is not necessary, we can apply for more memory at a time to reduce unnecessary synchronization.

Title: If call HBaseAdmin#snapshotAsync but forget call isSnapshotFinished then SnapshotHFileCleaner will skip to run every time
New scenario/use case: concrete task: remove the SnapshotSentinel from snapshotHandlers in SnapshotManage
Impact: uxepected result: skip to run every time
Note: If call HBaseAdmin#snapshotAsync but forget call isSnapshotFinished, then SnapshotHFileCleaner will skip to run every time

Title: The minimun number of region should be CONFIGURable
Note: the minimun number of region should be configurable in normalizable

Title: Provide a configuration to adjust the weight of EC recovery tasks to adjust the speed of recovery
Note: we can add a coefficient for user to tune the weight of EC recovery tasks.

Title: Give the user the option of specifying a minimum message per partition per batch when using kafka direct API with backpressure
Note: It would be better if the user has the option of setting the minimum instead of just a hard coded 1 limit.

Title: Add spark.shuffle.mapStatus.compression.codec conf
Note: All the other compressions have conf. Could we do it for this too? (We already have this functionality for broadcast/rdd/shuffle/shuflleSpill, so it might be better to have the same functionality for MapStatus as well.)

Title: Make queue size of BlockReportProcessingThread configurable
New scenario/use case: vague usecase: Block report queue is full
Impact: Failure: Block report queue is full
Note: Worth noting that we had a few experience with "Block report queue is full" and client would fail to close files.

Title: Limit the number of Snapshots allowed to be created for a Snapshottable Directory
New scenario/use case: vague workload: large number snapshot deletion
Note: A snapshot table directory is able to accommodate 65,536 snapshots. In case a directory has large no of snapshots , deletion of any of the earlier snapshots take a lot of time which might lead to namenode crash (HDFS-11225)

Title: [SBN Read] Namenode crashes if one of The JN is down.
New scenario/use case: vague: one of The JN is down
Note: "I don't think we want a fixed thread pool", "Hey guys, discussed this with Chen. It seems that we need a pool of only 3 threads, which can be reused for each iteration of tailing."

Title: Make PeriodicCommitLogService.blockWhenSyncLagsNanos configurable
New scenario/use case: vague workload:a lag in flushing to disc
Impact: perf: block for up to 15 seconds
Note: When using the default values for periodic commitlog, the sync is every ten seconds and if there's a lad in flushing to disc, we can block for up to 15 seconds (sync time * 1.5). However, if you lower the sync time to 1 second, for example, the block time is only 1.5 seconds (not acceptable in all situations). Admittedly this is only an expert-level setting, but useful in some cases.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: Admittedly this is only an expert-level setting, but useful in some cases.

Title: Add CONFIGURATION to allow disabling registration of static sources to the metrics system
New scenario/use case: vague: in the cases when the metrics in question are not needed
Impact: perf: can produce a significant amount of data
Note: The Spark metrics system produces many different metrics and not all of them are used at the same time. This proposes to introduce a configuration parameter to allow disabling the registration of metrics in the "static sources" category

Title: Add an OPTION to ignore block locations when listing file
New scenario/use case: concrete Environment: in a PROD environment, a table can be so huge that even fetching all these location informations need take tens of seconds.
Impact: perf: data locality is never reachable.
Note: n our PROD env, we have a pure Spark cluster, I think this is also pretty common, where computation is separated from storage layer. In such deploy mode, data locality is never reachable. And there are some configurations in Spark scheduler to reduce waiting time for data locality(e.g. "spark.locality.wait"). While, problem is that, in listing file phase, the location informations of all the files, with all the blocks inside each file, are all fetched from the distributed file system. Actually, in a PROD environment, a table can be so huge that even fetching all these location informations need take tens of seconds. To improve such scenario, Spark need provide an option, where data locality can be totally ignored, all we need in the listing file phase are the files locations, without any block location informations.

Title: Add an option to not disable short-circuit reads on failures
New scenario/use case: concrete Task: data ingestion makes use of the -appendToFile operation to add new data to existing HDFS files
Impact: perf: have a big performance impact for the client operations
Note: It might also be interesting to be able to control how long SCR is disabled for in the "unknown response" case. 10 minutes seems a bit to long and not being able to change that is a problem.

Title: Make block increment deletion number configurable
Impact: perf: hold the write lock long time
Note: When NN deletes a large directory, it will hold the write lock long time. For improving this, we remove the blocks in a batch way. So that other waiters have a chance to get the lock. But right now, the batch number is a hard-coded value. We can make this value configurable, so that we can control the frequency of other waiters to get the lock chance.

Title: Add an ability to disable CacheReplicationMonitor.
Note: we have seen from the FSNamesystem metrics added in HDFS-10872 that CacheReplicationMonitor can have nontrivial overheads even on a cluster with no caching enabled, and currently there is no way to disable it completely..

Title: [SBN read] Allow CONFIGURably enable/disable AlignmentContext on NameNode.
New scenario/use case: concrete workload: Ran a few benchmarks (NNThroughputBenchmark) and profiler (VisualVM) today on an Observer-enabled cluster. Would like to share the results with the community. The cluster has 1 Observer node.
Impact: perf: One potential overhead of SBN read
Note: As brought up under HDFS-14277, we should make sure SBN read has no performance impact when it is not enabled. One potential overhead of SBN read is maintaining and updating additional state status on NameNode. Specifically, this is done by creating/updating/checking a GlobalStateIdContext instance. Currently, even without enabling SBN read, this logic is still be checked. We can make this configurable so that when SBN read is not enabled, there is no such overhead and everything works as-is.

Title: Make buffer of BlockReaderRemote#newBlockReader#BufferedOutputStream configurable.
New scenario/use case: vague: It is recommended to adjust the value according to the workload, which can reduce unnecessary memory usage and the frequency of the garbage collection. A value of 512 might be reasonable.
Impact: perf: Reducing the size of the buffer will also reduce the frequency of gc and improve read performance.

Title: RBF: Reject requests when a Router is overloaded.
Note: A Router might be overloaded when handling special cases (e.g. a slow subcluster)

Title: Provide option to not capture the accessTime change of a file to snapshot if no other modification has been done to this file
New scenario/use case: concrete usecase: if the accessTime of a file changed before a snapshot is taken,  a lot of files to be examined.
Impact: perf: snapshotDiff to slow down quite a lot
Note: Currently, if the accessTime of a file changed before a snapshot is taken, this accessTime will be captured in the snapshot, even if there is no other modifications made to this file. This jira is to provide an option to skip capturing accessTime only change to snapshot. Thus snapshotDiff can be done faster.

Title: Ability to disallow safemode NN to become active
New scenario/use case: vague workload:are large number of files and blocks in HDFS
Impact: perf: the cluster will be not fully functioning for quite a while
Note: It can take tens of minutes for a cold started Namenode to get out of safemode, especially when there are large number of files and blocks in HDFS, that means if a Namenode in safemode become active, the cluster will be not fully functioning for quite a while, even if it can while there is some Namenode not in safemode.

Title: SnapshotDiff - support diff generation on any snapshot root descendant directory.
New scenario/use case: vague environment: snapshot root directory is very huge
Impact: perf: the snapshot diff report generation can take minutes
Note: The command today only accepts the path that is a snapshot root. There are many deployments where the snapshot root is configured at the higher level directory but the diff report needed is only for a specific directory under the snapshot root. In these cases, the diff report can be filtered for changes pertaining to the directory we are interested in. But when the snapshot root directory is very huge, the snapshot diff report generation can take minutes even if we are interested to know the changes only in a small directory. So, it would be highly performant if the diff report calculation can be limited to only the interesting sub-directory of the snapshot root instead of the whole snapshot root.

Title: RBF: Add dfs.federation.router.mount-table.cache.enable so that users can disable cache.
New scenario/use case: concrete workload: hundreds of millions file access
Note: Disabling Cache is efficient when hundreds of millions files are access, in such scenes ProxyAvgTime only costs 0.0x ms by directly computing remote path,  It caches the request paths, and return the remote location. Maybe request paths are hundreds of millions and the cache is inefficient

Title: Parallelize initial materialized view build
New scenario/use case: concrete Workload: node with lots of data (~3TB)
Note: On a node with lots of data (~3TB) building a materialized view takes several weeks, which is not ideal. It's doing this in a single thread.

Title: Allow verbosity of InMemoryLevelDBAliasMapServer to be configurable.
New scenario/use case: vague Scale: large numer of nodes
Note: This leads to too many log messages when running with large number of nodes/rpcs to the InMemoryLevelDBAliasMapServer

Title: Start/Stop compactions at region server level
New scenario/use case: vague workload: when too many regions became eligible for compactions at once
Impact: Resource overuse: extremely expensive to run periodic minor / major compactions
Note: Depending on current server load, it can be extremely expensive to run periodic minor / major compactions. It would be helpful to have a feature where a user could use the shell or a client tool to explicitly cancel an in-progress compactions. This would allow a system to recover when too many regions became eligible for compactions at once

Title: Accommodate the hbase-indexer/lily/SEP consumer deploy-typePatch to start a standalone RegionServer that register's itself andoptionally stands up Services.
Note: This patch adds configuration to disable RegionServer internal Services, Managers, Caches, etc., starting up. By default a RegionServer starts up an Admin and Client Service.

Title: Accommodate the hbase-indexer/lily/SEP consumer deploy-typePatch to start a standalone RegionServer that register's itself andoptionally stands up Services.
Note: This patch adds configuration to disable RegionServer internal Services, Managers, Caches, etc., starting up. By default a RegionServer starts up an Admin and Client Service.

Title: Warn if monitored RPC task has been tied up beyond a configurable threshold
Note: Warn if monitored task has been tied up beyond a configurable threshold. We especially want to do this for RPC tasks

Title: Warn if monitored RPC task has been tied up beyond a configurable threshold
Note: Warn if monitored task has been tied up beyond a configurable threshold. We especially want to do this for RPC tasks.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: We could restrict this change to them so its completely optional.

Title: Making {max min}SessionTimeout configurable for MiniZooKeeperCluster
New scenario/use case: vague when the laptop goes to sleep
Note: Right now the mini cluster on application developers laptops keep crashing when the laptop goes to sleep because Zookeeper times out.

Title: Making {max min}SessionTimeout configurable for MiniZooKeeperCluster
New scenario/use case: vague when the laptop goes to sleep
Note: Right now the mini cluster on application developers laptops keep crashing when the laptop goes to sleep because Zookeeper times out.

Title: Configurable maximum number of buckets
Impact: Failure: driver fail over will not work, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Note: We have an 80TB workload and to keep partitions "manageable" we do need to use a large number of buckets. While it might seem a lot today it is expected that workloads will continue to increase in size...

Title: Add flag to disable stream capability enforcement
New scenario/use case: concrete Environment: FileSystem doesn't support flush/sync
Note: Sounds like LocalFileSystem doesn't support flush/sync. solutions: telling CommonFSUtils to ignore the check on LocalFileSystem

Title: Allow enabling TCP keep alive on the RPC connections
New scenario/use case: concrete workload: We run a cluster of ~1000 cores in GCE using preemptible VMs for executors / workers and a standard (non-preemptible) master VM
Impact: Failure: master errors with "Too many open files" and can not accept connections anymore
Note: It's currently possible to enable TCP keep alive on the worker / executor, but is not possible to configure on other RPC connections. It's unclear to me why this could be the case. Keep alive is more important for the master to protect it against suddenly departing workers / executors, thus I think it's very important to have it.

Title: Improve merkle tree size and time on heap
Note: We get out of memory errors while repairing (incremental or full) our keyspace
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: It seems like the simplest solution might be to just repair smaller subranges if youre ooming on huge merkle trees during repair

Title: configurable range of delay in PeriodicMemstoreFlusher
New scenario/use case: vague workload: man'y regions and CFs
Impact: Failure: overwhelming the filesystem with too many flushes at once
Note: When RSs(RegionServer) have a LOT of regions and CFs(column family), flushing everything within 5 minutes is not always doable. It might be interesting to be able to increase the RANGE_OF_DELAY. we might end up overwhelming the filesystem with too many flushes at once

Title: Make broadcast-exchange thread pool keepalivetime and maxThreadNumber configurable
New scenario/use case: vague use case: slow GC speed
Note: Thead object do not GC quickly

Title: Add `allocate_tokens_for_local_rf` yaml option for token allocation that doesn't require keyspace knowledge/existence
Impact: Failure: The real keyspace can not be used
Note: This is problematic in a number of ways. The real keyspace can not be used when adding new datacenters as, in practice, all its nodes need to be up and running before it has the capacity to replicate data into it. New datacenters (or lift-and-shifting a cluster via datacenter migration) therefore has to be done using a dummy keyspace that duplicates the replication strategy+factor of the real keyspace. This gets even more difficult come version 4.0, as the replica factor can not even be defined in new datacenters before those datacenters are up and running. These issues are removed by avoiding the keyspace definition and lookup, and presuming the replica strategy is by datacenter, ie NTS. This can be done with the use of an allocate_tokens_for_dc_rf option.

Title: HealthMonitor connection retry times should be configurable.
Impact: Failure: This error caused a failover and affects the availability of that cluster
Note: On our production HDFS cluster, some client's burst requests cause the tcp kernel queue full on NameNode's host,  since the configuration value of "net.ipv4.tcp_syn_retries" in our environment is 1, so after 3 seconds, the ZooKeeper Healthmonitor got an connection error

Title: [REPLICATION] make ship edits timeout configurable
New scenario/use case: vague workload: some HFile is big enough
Impact: Failure: timeout exception may be occurred.
Note: The default rpc timeout for ReplicationSourceShipper#shipEdits is 60s, when bulkload replication enabled, timeout exception may be occurred. when there is slow N/w and some file copy fails always to copy within the configured time. For example, if some HFile is big enough which may take more than 60 sec to be copied then it will always timedout.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: Then main goal of this change is providing an alternative valve for increasing the timeout?

Title: adding options to skip deletes/puts on target when running SyncTable
New scenario/use case: concrete usecase: clusters with active-active replication got out of sync
Note: We had a situation where two clusters with active-active replication got out of sync, but both had data that should be kept. The tables in question never have data deleted, but ingestion had happened on the two different clusters, some rows had been even updated. This could be solved by adding an option to skip deletes for SyncTable.

Title: adding options to skip deletes/puts on target when running SyncTable
New scenario/use case: concrete usecase: clusters with active-active replication got out of sync
Note: We had a situation where two clusters with active-active replication got out of sync, but both had data that should be kept. The tables in question never have data deleted, but ingestion had happened on the two different clusters, some rows had been even updated. This could be solved by adding an option to skip deletes for SyncTable.

Title: Optionally ignore edits for dropped tables for replication.
New scenario/use case: concrete usecase: dropped a table from both the source and the sink
Impact: uxepected result: Now all replication is backed up behind these unreplicatable edits
Note: We just ran into a scenario where we dropped a table from both the source and the sink, but the source still has outstanding edits that now it could not get rid of. Now all replication is backed up behind these unreplicatable edits. We should have an option to ignore edits for tables dropped at the source.

Title: Make the driver failover_timeout CONFIGurable
Note: Instead of setting the driver framework failover_timeout to zero, the failover_timeout will be configurable via a spark-submit config option. The default value will still be zero if the configuration is not set.

Title: Add a CONFIG for `URL.setURLStreamHandlerFactory`
New scenario/use case: concrete task: when the users tries to use another custom factories or 3rd party library (trying to set this).
Note: URL.setURLStreamHandlerFactory() in SharedState causes URL.openConnection() returns FsUrlConnection object, which is not compatible with HttpURLConnection. This will cause exception when using some third party http library (e.g. scalaj.http).

Title: hdfs mover -p /path times out after 20 min.
New scenario/use case: concrete usecase: block move was enqueued
Note: Mover could have fail after 20+ minutes if a block move was enqueued for this long, between two DataNodes due to an internal constant that was introduced for Balancer, but affected Mover as well.

Title: Make rpc timeout and retry for shuffle registration CONFIGurable.
New scenario/use case: vague workload: shuffle service is busy transferring large amount of data
Impact: Failure: fail to register with the shuffle service, eventually failing the job
Note: This works well for small workloads but under heavy workload when the shuffle service is busy transferring large amount of data we see significant delay in responding to the registration request, as a result we often see the executors fail to register with the shuffle service, eventually failing the job. We need to make these two parameters configurable.

Title: Make rpc timeout and retry for shuffle registration CONFIGurable.
New scenario/use case: vague workload: shuffle service is busy transferring large amount of data
Impact: Failure: fail to register with the shuffle service, eventually failing the job
Note: This works well for small workloads but under heavy workload when the shuffle service is busy transferring large amount of data we see significant delay in responding to the registration request, as a result we often see the executors fail to register with the shuffle service, eventually failing the job. We need to make these two parameters configurable.

Title: Make QJM HTTP URL connection timeout configurable
Impact: Failure: huge RPC spike could occur with the timeout.
Note: The HTTP connection is opened while holding the NN read/write lock (see readOp() inside FSEditLogLoaderand how it calls EditLogFileInputStream#init() to open HTTP connection with JNs.), so huge RPC spike could occur with the timeout.

Title: Make QJM HTTP URL connection timeout configurable
Impact: Failure: huge RPC spike could occur with the timeout.
Note: The HTTP connection is opened while holding the NN read/write lock (see readOp() inside FSEditLogLoaderand how it calls EditLogFileInputStream#init() to open HTTP connection with JNs.), so huge RPC spike could occur with the timeout.

Title: Block Storage: volume creation times out while creating 3TB volume because of too many containers.
Note: Volume creation times out while creating 3TB volume because of too many containers. Looking into the logs it can be seen that the volume 614 containers were created before the timeout.

Title: Make k8s client timeouts configurable
Note: SparkSubmit closes with SocketTimeoutException in kubernetes mode

Title: Make k8s client timeouts configurable
Note: SparkSubmit closes with SocketTimeoutException in kubernetes mode

Title: Make k8s client timeouts configurable
Note: SparkSubmit closes with SocketTimeoutException in kubernetes mode

Title: Make k8s client timeouts configurable
Note: SparkSubmit closes with SocketTimeoutException in kubernetes mode

Title: Partitioned outbound internode TCP connections can occur when nodes restart
New scenario/use case: concrete Environment: AWS networks (and other stateful firewalls)
Note: This should be exceedingly rare, but AWS networks (and other stateful firewalls) apparently suffer from this issue. Defensive settings for protecting Cassandra from true network partitions
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: It's a very rare bug

Title: Make Jetty's requestHeaderSize configurable in Spark
New scenario/use case: concrete Environment: user is a member of many Active Directory user groups
Note: too large header size will cause HTTP 413. This issue may occur if the user is a member of many Active Directory user groups. The header size increases together with the number of user groups
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: this is the first time we've heard of someone hitting this limit

Title: RBF: Add option to fail operations when a subcluster is unavailable
New scenario/use case: vague use case: subcluster is unavailable
Impact: uxepected result:  succeed operations like getListing()
Note: When a subcluster is unavailable, we succeed operations like getListing(). We should add an option to fail the operation if one of the subclusters is unavailable.

Title: Make FsServerDefaults cache configurable
Note: "On the original jira some concerns were expressed about the lockless rpc for server defaults (I wouldn't care if it was 1min...), so as a middle ground, I'd suggest making the server defaults refresh interval configurable."
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: so as a middle ground

Title: Add an option to disallow 'namenode format -force'.
Note: We are just trying to avoid losing data by operator mistake. But from a sysadmin/developer hat on, I do like that fact that I can format a cluster with data. I do that when I test and develop
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: from a sysadmin/developer hat on

Title: [SQL] Type comparison should respect case-sensitive SQL conf
Note: This issue aims to support case-insensitive type comparisions in Set operation. Currently, SET operations fail due to case-sensitive type comparision failure .

Title: SHS may delete driver log file of in progress application
New scenario/use case: concrete task: if you just keep writing to the file
Impact: uxepected result: SHS may delete driver log file
Note: HDFS doesn't update the file size reported by the NM if you just keep writing to the file; this makes the SHS believe the file is inactive, and so it may delete it after the configured max age for log files.

Title: [SQL][SS] Redact Output of Explain
Note: When calling explain on a query, the output can contain sensitive information. We should provide an admin/user to redact such information.

Title: Thrift server supports read-only mode
Note: Provide option for thrift server to support read-only mode.To start the thrift server, use the -ro option or set hbase.thrift.readonly to true.

Title: Make HttpFS' ACLs RegEx configurable
Note: Part of HDFS-5608 added support for GET/SET ACLs over WebHDFS. This currently identifies the passed arguments via a hard-coded regex that mandates certain group and user naming styles.

Title: Add delegation token custom AdminClient configuration
introduce --CONFIG_DIM directive
Note: allow the sql test files to specify different dimensions of config sets during testing.

Title: [YARN] Allow AM to restart after initial tokens expire.
Note: I also made two currently hardcoded values (the renewal time ratio, and the retry wait) configurable; while this probably never needs to be set the retry wait) configurable; while this probably never needs to be set by anyone in a production environment, it helps with testing; that's also why they're not documented.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity:while this probably never needs to be set by anyone in a production environment

Title: [PYTHON] Add a CONFIG to control if PySpark should use daemon or not for workers
New scenario/use case: vague task: test Windows specific issue.
Note: It makes easier to test Windows specific issue.

Title: Make QuorumJournalManager timeout properties configurable
Note: Make QuorumJournalManager timeout properties configurable using a common key.
discussion: Balancing flexibility and simplicity: Since these don't occur during normal operation, we can use rather lengthy timeouts, and don't need to make them configurable

Title: Add a configuration for valid plan hours instead of constant 24 hours in the code.
Note: Add a configuration for valid plan hours, instead of constant 24 hours in the code.
